title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe that the scientists will determine if the mice survive to successfully reproduce.
The response describes that the scientists will determine if the mice survive to successfully reproduce.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the color of the ground in each of the enclosures as the independent variable.
The response identifies the color of the ground in each of the enclosures as the independent variable.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the null hypothesis is that the color of the enclosure ground will not affect the frequency of light and dark mice in the population.
The response states that the null hypothesis is that the color of the enclosure ground will not affect the frequency of light and dark mice in the population.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not justify the claim by indicating that mice with a coat color that helped them blend into the environment were able to avoid predation and reproduce, increasing the frequency of their genes in the population.

The response justifies the claim by indicating that mice with a coat color that helped them blend into the environment were able to avoid predation and reproduce, increasing the frequency of their genes in the population.
